title: Video Editor (YouTube – Long-Form Weekly Content)
description:
Position Type: Freelance / Ongoing Contract

Project Frequency: 1 video per week

Video Length: 16–22 minutes

About the Role: seeking a highly skilled, professional video editor to collaborate on a weekly YouTube production. This is not a basic cut-and-trim role. We’re looking for someone who understands pacing, storytelling, emotion, music layering, and audience retention — not someone relying on automated or template-based AI editing tools.

If you know how to craft narrative-driven content that keeps viewers engaged from the first 10 seconds to the final frame, this is for you.

Responsibilities

• Edit one long-form YouTube video per week (16–22 minutes)

• Structure content for strong retention and flow

• Integrate background music strategically to enhance tone and emotion

• Add professional-level transitions, sound design, and subtle motion graphics where appropriate

• Color correct and audio balance for a polished, broadcast-quality finish

• Insert B-roll, overlays, and graphics that enhance storytelling (not distract from it)

• Deliver on agreed deadlines consistently

Requirements

• Proven experience editing long-form YouTube content (portfolio required)

• Strong understanding of pacing, narrative rhythm, and viewer psychology

• Skilled in professional editing software (Cap Cut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)

• Experience sourcing and layering licensed music

• Strong audio mixing skills

• Ability to take creative direction and also offer constructive input

• Must NOT rely on auto-editing templates or generic AI-generated cuts

Ideal Candidate: Understands YouTube retention strategy

• Knows how to build emotional arcs through music and pacing

• Detail-oriented and consistent

• Reliable communicator

• Treats editing as storytelling, not just technical assembly

To Apply, please provide:

• Portfolio of long-form YouTube work (16+ minutes preferred)

• A brief explanation of your editing process

• Your rate per video

title: CREDIT REPAIR - Dispute Expert
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and knowledgeable Credit Repair Specialist with extensive hands-on experience across all aspects of the credit repair process. The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in advanced dispute strategies, regulatory compliance, and consumer-driven remediation techniques.



This role requires a comprehensive understanding of credit sweep methodologies, including but not limited to CFPB, BBB, and FTC disputes, as well as the use of secondary bureaus, credit freezes, factual disputes, and Metro 2 compliance standards. Strong working knowledge of federal laws and regulations—such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA), and Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA)—is essential.



The successful candidate will be proficient in developing and executing aggressive, customized dispute letters authored on behalf of consumers and supported by relevant case law. These disputes should effectively address a wide range of credit inaccuracies, from straightforward errors to complex, multi-layered credit issues.



Additional expertise in check system removals, including ChexSystems, Early Warning Services (EWS), and rental history disputes, is highly preferred. Familiarity with advanced tactics for early warning removals and banking-related reporting systems will be considered a strong asset.



Proficiency with credit repair software platforms—such as Client Dispute Manager or comparable systems—is required to efficiently manage disputes, track compliance timelines, and maintain accurate client records.



Currently this position is focused on disputes only, we will ask for updates from the candidate once a new credit report is pulled and assessed. However we handle all direct communication with clients. This position is part time with 20 clients/month, but as we grow over the next few months it will be full time

title: Shopify Developer
description:
Job Summary



At One Arrow Digital, we are a specialized engineering team dedicated to helping high-growth brands unleash the power of e-commerce. We combine technical mastery of the Shopify platform with a deep understanding of the customer journey to build performant, high-converting websites on the world’s largest e-commerce platform.



We’re currently looking for a Shopify Developer to join the team and work directly with our leadership to build custom themes and private apps that define the future of digital retail.



The Opportunity



Joining the Shopify Development team at One Arrow Digital means stepping into a pivotal role during our expansion from a solo operation to a structured agency. You will support the full lifecycle of e-commerce transformation, from pixel-perfect frontend execution to custom API integrations. This role offers direct mentorship, a fast-paced Agile environment, and the chance to ensure every line of code contributes to a faster, more secure, and higher-converting user experiences.



Role Details



Position: Shopify Developer (Junior Level)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Location: Preferably Bicol (Naga City area) or Remote (PH)



What You’ll Be Doing:

• Figma-to-Code Implementation: Converting complex Figma design files into responsive, high-performance Shopify themes with 1:1 visual accuracy.

• Custom Storefront Development: Building modular Shopify themes from scratch using Liquid, HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS.

• App & Integration Support: Assisting in the development of custom Shopify apps and integrating third-party services (ERP, CRM, 3PL).

• Performance Optimization: Analyzing and solving performance bottlenecks to maintain industry-leading Core Web Vitals.

• Technical Collaboration: Participating in code reviews and learning Shopify Best Practices, including Checkout Extensibility and Hydrogen.



What You’ll Need:



• Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.

• Experience: At least 2 years of professional development experience, with a focus on web technologies. Direct Shopify experience preferred, but not required.

• Core Skills: Solid foundation in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (ES6+).

• Work Style: A positive mindset, an eagerness to learn, and the flexibility to work graveyard hours for overlap with our Philippine time zone and global clients.

• Communication: Excellent English skills (written and verbal) are a must for team and client collaboration.



What Sets You Apart



• Existing Shopify Knowledge: Proficiency in Liquid and familiarity with the Shopify Admin API.

• Backend Comfort: Background or experience with API integrations and knowledge of non-relational databases (e.g., MongoDB, Firebase).

• Advanced Stack: Familiarity with Shopify Plus, Tailwind CSS, or headless commerce via the Storefront API.

• Modern Tooling: Experience using Shopify CLI, and Git-based version control, CI/CD pipelines.

• Precision: A "pixel-perfect" mindset where you treat the design as a blueprint, not just a suggestion.



Hiring Process



Application ? Intro Call ? Take-Home Project ? Technical Interview ? Offer



Questions? Reach out: 

Apply here:

title: Project Engineer
description:

3. Identifying the gaps between BOQ and drawings, specifications and conditions of the contract and taking it for logical closure.

4. Participates in the pre-tendering activities with client and the Project Managers and raising relevant pre-bid queries from the given tender.

5. Monitors and controls costs throughout the project duration, identifying cost-saving opportunities and submits corrective action as promptly as these are noted.

title: US HR Operations Specialist (US HR & Financial Experience Required)
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and service-driven HR Operations Specialist with financial experience to support our clients across financial reporting, HR operations, payroll, and compliance.



We are a management consulting company that supports small business owners who want to grow sustainably without taking on equity investors. We support growth strategy, finance, operations, human resources, and systems related to those areas, for a wide variety of business types. We typically start with businesses when they reach US$500,000 - $2 million in revenues and stay with them until they are ready to hire senior leaders, at $10-$15 million.



You’ll work directly with the company’s CEO and our small business owner clients, helping them understand their numbers, streamline back-office functions, and stay compliant with state and federal requirements. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys blending finance, HR, and operational problem-solving while collaborating closely with others.



Key Responsibilities



1. Finance Support & Reporting

- Using our forecasting methodology, build 1–2 year forecasts and pro forma models for US businesses (including payroll, debt, and operating expenses).

- Support the CEO in preparing agendas and reports for clients’ monthly business reviews.

- Review and interpret monthly financial statements; identify trends, variances, and actionable insights.

- Validate closed books prepared by accountants or bookkeeping teams.

- Use accounting software to pull reports, review transactions, and support analysis (closing is a plus, not required).

- Translate financial data into clear, practical explanations for clients.



2. HR & Payroll Operations

- Manage HR workflows in Gusto or Rippling: policies, employee documents, onboarding & offboarding.

- Run payroll cycles, bonus runs, and exit payroll accurately and on time.

- Manage quarterly and year-end tax reporting.

- Set up benefits and ensure deductions (including retirement plans) sync correctly.

- Monitor the HR support inbox and resolve client requests promptly.

- Maintain secure, organized digital HR files.



3. Compliance & Administrative Support

- Understand rules for US small business designations like sole proprietor, LLC, and S-corporation.

- Handle compliance registrations via CorpNet or state portals.

- Track notices, filings, and deadlines to keep clients compliant.

- Research employment requirements using the company’s paid SHRM account.



4. Client Partnership & Support

- Work closely with business owners to provide clarity on financial and HR processes.

- Respond to client questions promptly, accurately, and with a service-oriented approach.

- Offer insights that help clients run smoother, more compliant operations.

- And any other tasks or responsibilities assigned



Required Technical Skills



- Ability to read and interpret financial statements

- Proficiency with cloud-based accounting software (QBO, Xero, etc.)

- Hands-on experience with Gusto or Rippling

- Familiarity with employer compliance workflows



Strong proficiency with:

- Google Workspace

- Airtable (REQUIRED)

- Excel/Sheets (modeling, formulas, cleanup)

- HR systems & secure file management



Nice to Have:

- Experience assisting with monthly book closings

- Experience building financial forecasts or pro formas

- Multi-state employer compliance knowledge

- SHRM-based research experience



Experience & Background

- Proven extensive experience in finance operations (planning, analysis, reporting), HR operations, payroll, or business operations.

- Experience supporting small businesses or service-based companies

- Strong analytical ability and clear communication skills

- High accuracy in financial, payroll, and compliance work

- Trusted with sensitive data and confidential information



Working Style & Personality

- Curious, detail-driven, and analytical

- Warm, client-focused, and collaborative

- Organized, reliable, and thorough

- Strong follow-through; comfortable with process-heavy tasks

- Calm, professional, and proactive

- High integrity when handling financial and HR data



What this role includes

This is a full-time remote position. The role offers a weekly compensation rate, so you can focus on the work and not manage the clock. Includes provisioned access to our company’s cloud-based systems, a monthly technology stipend for use of your internet and computer, and a health insurance allowance.



Why This Role Matters

We believe in founders who want to make a change through their work. We partner with our small business owners to support the self-funded growth of their companies, without asking them to compromise the integrity of their strongly-held beliefs and principles. We do not apply a “program” to our clients, but work with them to design a business that builds their financial security and aligns with their purpose. We serve as a trusted operating partner across strategy, operations, human resources, finance, and systems, and a trusted personal partner in meeting their own goals. We support their growth as people and leaders.





Kindly complete the form below so we can process your application.






WE WILL NOT ENTERTAIN CANDIDATES WITHOUT THE COMPLETED APPLICATION FORM.

title: Ai video editor
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce company looking for a talented and disciplined video editor to produce high-performing ad videos. IMPORTANT: All work is done in Spanish (Spain and Mexico markets).

Main Mission

Your role will be to edit videos optimized for Meta Ads and TikTok Ads, following strict briefs and processes. Work by batches: 1 batch = same video with 3 different hooks. Minimum volume: 5 batches/week (15 videos).

Required Skills

    •    Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or After Effects.

Conditions

Application Process (mandatory)

Only profiles with e-commerce experience and successful test will be considered. No improvisation—focus on fast execution and feedback.

title: E-Commerce Research Assistant — COD & Bogus Buyer Problems in Philippines
description:
I'm researching how Filipino online sellers deal with COD (Cash on Delivery) returns and bogus buyers. I need someone who is an active member of Filipino seller communities and understands this problem firsthand.

What you'll do:



Join or search through 10-15
 groups for Shopee, Lazada, and TikTok Shop sellers in the Philippines (examples: "Shopee Sellers Philippines", "TikTok Shop Sellers PH", "Online Sellers Philippines", groups with "bogus buyer" in the name)

Original post text (Tagalog is fine)

Number of reactions and comments

Top 5-10 most useful comments

Any tools, apps, bots, or services mentioned by sellers

Any prices mentioned for those tools

 bots that sellers use to verify COD orders or block bogus buyers

Write a short summary (1-2 pages) of your findings: How bad is this problem? What are sellers doing about it? What tools exist? What's missing?



Ideal candidate:



You are or have been an online seller on Shopee/Lazada/TikTok Shop Philippines

You are already a member of Filipino seller
 groups

You understand Tagalog seller slang and community culture

You can work independently and deliver within 5-7 days



Deliverables:



Google Sheet with 30-50 documented posts

List of 10-15 TikTok videos

List of all tools/apps/services found

1-2 page written summary



Timeline: 5-7 days

title: Influencer Campaign Account Coordinator
description:
Company: Red Yolk

Location: Remote

Type: Part-Time (with potential of full time)

Industry: Influencer Marketing / Digital Marketing



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a fast-growing influencer marketing agency working with leading brands across Australia and New Zealand. We’re looking for a detail-oriented, highly organised Account Coordinator (Virtual Assistant) to support our team with campaign coordination, influencer communication, admin, reporting, and logistics.



This role is designed to take day-to-day operational workload off our founders and account managers, allowing them to focus on strategy, growth, and client relationships.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Campaign Setup & Admin

- Set up new campaigns inside Monday.com (our work operating system)

- Create campaign folders and maintain documents in Google Drive

- Input budgets, timelines, deliverables, usage rights, and campaign details

- Ensure every campaign is fully organised before outreach begins



Influencer Outreach & Communication

- Manage influencer
 communication

- Handle initial outreach, follow-ups, and confirmations

- Be the main point of contact for influencers during campaigns

- Answer basic questions regarding timelines and deliverables



Contracts, Agreements & Onboarding

- Prepare influencer agreements

- Collect and input legal names, ABN details, business addresses, and bank account details

- Track signing status and follow up on outstanding contracts

- Onboard influencers into campaigns and confirm all expectations



Scheduling & Content Tracking

- Manage influencer posting schedules

- Track content delivery deadlines

- Maintain content approval and revision tracking sheets

- Send reminders to ensure deadlines are met



Logistics & Product Delivery

- Coordinate product shipping for campaigns

- Confirm delivery details and tracking numbers

- Ensure influencers receive products on time

- Flag delivery delays to the internal team



Payments & Reporting

- Track post-live payment eligibility

- Ensure influencer payment details are accurate

- Assist with payment coordination

- Collect campaign performance data and populate reports



Platform Management

- Keep Monday.com boards updated

- Maintain clean file structures inside Google Drive

- Ensure campaign data stays accurate



Weekly Influencer Discovery & Database Growth

- Weekly identification of new influencers to add to the database

- Discover creators in niches including food, lifestyle, fitness, beauty, home & interiors

- Review creators based on content quality, engagement, and brand suitability

- Add influencer details including handle, niche, platform, followers, and contact info

- Maintain a high-quality up-to-date influencer database



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Campaigns run smoothly without founder involvement in admin

- Influencers are supported and organised

- No missing contracts, payment details, or reporting

- Clean, accurate systems



SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

- Strong English communication

- Highly organised and detail-driven

- Comfortable using Google Drive and spreadsheet tools

- Experience in influencer marketing or admin preferred

- Able to manage multiple campaigns



WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS

This role removes operational workload from the business owners so they can focus on growth, sales, and strategy.



HOW TO APPLY

Please submit:

- Your CV

- A short paragraph explaining your relevant experience

- Your weekly availability

- Your internet speed and work setup

title: SEO Copywriter / Content Writer
description:
Applications that do not include all required items in the “How to Apply” section will not be reviewed. We value attention to detail and the ability to follow instructions—key traits for this role. If any part of this application is incomplete or missing, your submission will be automatically disregarded.?



About Us:

We are a luxury watch-focused brand looking to elevate our content strategy. Our audience values detailed, accurate, and engaging content about high-end watches like Rolex, Patek Philippe, Audemars Piguet, Omega, and more. We are seeking a talented SEO Copywriter/Content Writer who combines creativity with technical SEO skills to help us deliver content that ranks and resonates.



Responsibilities:



- Write high-quality, human-sounding content using AI tools where appropriate.

- Conduct in-depth research on luxury watches and related topics.

- Implement SEO best practices, including on-page optimization, keyword research, internal linking, and contextual linking with effective anchor text.

- Format content for WordPress and Elementor, including basic HTML formatting.

- Apply basic LLM (Large Language Model) optimization techniques for content clarity and engagement.

- Create simple graphics or visuals using Canva to complement content.

- Stay up-to-date with SEO trends and best practices.



Requirements:



- Proven experience as a content writer, copywriter, or SEO writer.

- Familiarity with WordPress and Elementor; ability to format HTML.

- Basic understanding of SEO and LLM optimization.

- Experience with keyword research and internal linking strategies.

- Strong research skills, attention to detail, and ability to write accurately about luxury watches.

- Knowledge and passion for luxury watches (Rolex, Patek Philippe, Audemars Piguet, Omega, etc.) is a must.

- Experience writing for B2C audiences preferred.

- Basic graphic design skills using Canva.

- Eager to learn and adapt to new tools and strategies.



Why Join Us:

Work remotely with a flexible schedule.

Collaborate with a passionate team focused on luxury watch content.

Opportunity to expand your skills in SEO, content creation, and luxury brand marketing.



How to Apply





To help me get to know you better, please send:





1. Your DISC test - Take it here - Please send a link to your results/confirmation page (not a screenshot).





2. Your personality test - Take it here - Please send a link to your results/confirmation page (not a screenshot).





3. Your updated resume, showcasing your most relevant experience.



4. Typing Test - Take this typing test (30 seconds): 





5. A video or videos that answer the following. Feel free to give as much information and context as possible. Also please make sure that, when you submit the video(s) links, they are in public, viewable format.





a. Introduce and tell us about yourself. Hobbies/passions. Career/life/financial goals and in what amount of time? Be very specific here. What have you been saving money for? What specific item/asset is it? When do you expect to acquire it? How do you plan on achieving that goal?





b. Show off your work setup (computer/laptop, monitor(s), speakers, lights, etc) and tech setup - browser you use, other tech/platforms you use.





c. Think of one objective you’ve had to complete. What metrics were you measured on? (time, money, etc) Reverse engineer the objective with the target measurement in mind. Map out the process that you came up with in google docs, google sheets, or in canva as a visual representation. How could you have made it easier/faster/better using AI?



5. Submit your resume, portfolio, and 1–2 writing samples (preferably luxury watch-related) demonstrating your SEO and content skills. Include a brief note about your favorite luxury watch and why.



6. Complete the short writing task:

title: Shopify Store Builder, GMC Compliant
description:
WELLBALANCE SL is a fast-growing e-commerce company operating multiple Shopify stores across Europe and North America. We focus on building scalable, compliant, and structured online stores designed for long-term stability and sustainable growth.



To support our expansion, we are looking for a highly precise Shopify Store Setup Specialist whose sole responsibility is building new Shopify stores from scratch. This role is focused on structure, accuracy, and compliance — not marketing, CRO, or creative work.



Tasks

 • Build Shopify stores from scratch using predefined templates, SOPs, and checklists

 • Ensure each store is fully compliant with Google Merchant Center policies

 • Prepare stores to be approval-ready for Google Merchant Center with no missing requirements

 • Follow SOPs precisely and document completion for each store

 • Perform detailed quality checks before internal handover

 • Build 2–3 Shopify stores per week while maintaining consistent quality and structure



Requirements

 • Proven experience building Shopify stores from scratch

 • Strong knowledge of Shopify backend: settings, pages, navigation, policies, and store structure

 • Experience with Google Merchant Center compliance and requirements

 • Highly detail-oriented with a precision-driven mindset

 • Naturally perfectionistic and attentive to small details

 • Ability to follow templates, SOPs, and checklists without deviation

 • Fast execution while maintaining accuracy and consistency

 • Ability to deliver error-free work at scale





Benefits

 • Fully remote position

 • Long-term collaboration with a fast-scaling e-commerce company

 • Clear processes, templates, and expectations

 • Competitive compensation based on experience and output





How to Apply



Interested candidates should apply with:

 • Their resume

 • A short explanation of why structured and precise work suits them

 • Examples of Google Merchant Center–compliant Shopify stores built from scratch



If you enjoy building Shopify stores by the book, with precision and consistency, this role is for you.

title: Senior B2B Cold Caller/Appointment Setter  (Mainly UK Market)
description:
Location: Remote



Working Hours: UK business hours for calls 



Employment Type: Full-time / Part time or Contract (flexible)



Hours per week: We can be flexible on the number of hours



About our company



We are a multiple award-winning provider of training in sales, customer service and leadership for businesses. Our primary client base over 23 years has been in the UK luxury retail industry, but we’ve trained in other B2C industries such as contact centres, travel, estate agency and others. 



About the role



We are looking for a senior/experienced B2B caller who is confident to engage directly with business owners, senior people and decision-makers. This role will focus on researching companies, building prospect lists, creating an effective pipeline and making outbound calls to secure qualified appointments for our Managing Director. It is an appointment-setting role and not a closing position. 



The role will focus primarily on the UK market, but will also involve reaching out to other potential markets such as the US and the Philippines.



Key responsibilities



-Researching companies that match our ideal customer profile 

-Identifying key decision-makers, to build an accurate prospect list

-Cold calling prospects: Business Owners, Sales Directors, Head of Learning and Development

-Making outbound calls as a follow up after
 campaigns

-Booking qualified appointments for our Managing Director

-Keeping CRM and records up to date with accurate notes and outcomes

-Communicating with the team about updates, progress, challenges and ideas



What we are looking for



-Proven track record of selling or setting appointments for UK or western markets

-Excellent spoken and written English 

-Ability to speak with senior people and decision-makers

-A professional, warm approach, with good conversation control

-Confidence, resourcefulness and resilience to handle objections

-Experience researching companies using LinkedIn and other tools

-Expertise of CRM systems

-Motivation, good self-management and a results-driven focus 



Extra experience that’s a bonus



-Expertise in these industries: Luxury, Retail, Hospitality or Contact centres

-Experience of selling within the Philippines contact centre industry 

-Selling training in sales, management or customer service



What we offer



-Competitive base pay plus performance-based incentives

-Excellent communication and support from our team

-Opportunity to contribute ideas

-A fully remote role

-Potential for growth



How to apply

title: Project Manager
description:
The Project Manager oversees the full lifecycle of multiple high-impact projects, ensuring seamless coordination between leadership, clients, and production teams. As the main point of contact across these groups, you ensure clarity of expectations, alignment of goals, and smooth execution from initiation to delivery. You are responsible for strategic planning, problem-solving, critical thinking, risk mitigation, progress reporting, and maintaining project quality and timelines. Additionally, aside from handling your own projects, you will train, mentor, coach, develop, and supervise junior project managers, ensuring consistency and excellence across all project operations.



Key Responsibilities

1. Project Planning & Execution

Create, manage, and optimize detailed project plans and schedules.





Define project scope, objectives, deliverables, and success metrics

Allocate resources effectively and monitor workload distribution.

Lead project implementation in collaboration with Team Leaders.

Apply critical thinking to anticipate challenges and devise proactive solutions.

Ensure projects remain aligned with company goals and client requirements.

2. Coordination & Communication

Serve as the main point of contact between leadership, clients, and production teams.

Ensure all stakeholders are aligned on progress, expectations, changes, and risks.

Present comprehensive updates, reports, and recommended solutions to leadership and clients.

Lead internal and external meetings, setting clear expectations for project teams.

3. Monitoring, Reporting & Risk Management

Track and evaluate project progress against timelines and milestones.

Identify, assess, and resolve project issues and risks proactively.

Implement process adjustments and change management when needed.

Apply problem-solving skills to remove bottlenecks or obstacles affecting project goals.

Prepare and deliver regular status reports, escalation updates, and performance summaries.

4. Team Leadership & Development

Guide and support the project team to maintain productivity and quality.

Provide direction to team members alongside Team Leaders.

Train, mentor, coach, develop, and supervise junior project managers.

Oversee projects handled by junior project managers to ensure quality, consistency, and timely delivery.

Encourage critical thinking and proactive problem-solving within the team.

5. Documentation & Deliverables Management

Oversee complete project documentation, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.

Upload deliverables to cloud-based platforms for backup and tracking.

Maintain organized records of milestones, reports, approvals, and revisions.

Conduct post-project evaluations to assess performance, identify improvement areas, and implement lessons learned.





Competencies

Critical thinking and structured problem-solving.

Strong decision-making, leadership, and delegation skills.

Skilled in contract negotiation and stakeholder management.

Conflict resolution experience with calm and professional approach.

High adaptability to shifting priorities and tight deadlines.

Ability to remain effective in high-pressure environments.

Analytical mindset to identify risks, challenges, and innovative solutions.

title: GoHighLevel Expert & Marketing Specialist
description:
We are looking for an experienced GoHighLevel expert and marketing strategist to lead a full platform build across three sub-accounts for a US-based photography studio and education company. This role begins with a substantial setup project and transitions into ongoing management and strategic support across all three brands.



On the technical side you'll be building booking funnels, automated
 and SMS workflows, pipelines, online course funnels, digital product landing pages, and upsell sequences from the ground up. Our
 and SMS copy is already written — you'll be implementing and connecting existing content into a clean, scalable system rather than starting from scratch on content.



Beyond the build we need someone who thinks strategically about how leads move through a system, where they convert, and where they don't. Our brands serve both local in-person clients and an online audience buying courses and digital products, so understanding buyer journeys across both contexts is important. We don't want someone who builds what they're told and stops there — we want someone who brings ideas, flags opportunities, and treats the system like something they're proud to own.



Our brands are rooted in photography so the visual bar is higher than average. We're not looking for a designer, but you should have enough of a visual eye to make sound layout decisions and recognize when something doesn't meet the standard.

The ideal candidate is deeply experienced in GoHighLevel, highly organized, proactive, and comfortable using AI tools to support workflow and efficiency.

title: Are You Our Next Rock Star Content Operations Assistant?
description:
Help us turn raw ideas into finished, published content — calmly, cleanly, and consistently.



Salary: AUD $800–$900 / month (depending on experience)

Hours: Part-time, flexible (outcomes matter more than hours)



ABOUT US



We run two purpose-driven businesses based in Australia:

1. The Physio Doctor — a progressive physiotherapy clinic helping people move, heal, and feel at home in their bodies again

2. Empowered Wellness Academy — an online education platform blending health, nervous system regulation, movement, and personal leadership



We care deeply about quality, clarity, and impact.

We do not do rushed, sloppy, or chaotic work.

And we value people who take pride in finishing things properly.



ABOUT THE ROLE



You will be responsible for content operations — taking raw content created by Jillian (videos, scripts, notes) and turning it into finished, organised, and scheduled marketing assets.



Once something is handed to you, your job is to:

- organise it

- complete it

- schedule it

- and make sure nothing falls through the cracks



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys ownership, structure, and seeing work move from idea ? done.



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING



Your responsibilities may include:

- Taking raw videos and scripts and:

     - editing videos (clean, simple edits)

     - creating matching Canva designs

     - writing or formatting captions as provided



- Scheduling and publishing content using GoHighLevel (GHL)

- Organising files, folders, and content workflows so everything is easy to find

- Keeping track of what’s:

     - ready

     - in progress

     - scheduled

     - live

- Light transcription and editing using tools like ClipScribe, InShot, or similar

- Flagging anything that’s missing or unclear (instead of waiting)

- Supporting ongoing campaigns for both brands

- Helping maintain consistency, quality, and momentum



You are not expected to:

- write scripts from scratch

- be the creative director

- come up with content ideas independently



Your strength is execution and follow-through.



YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU:



- Are highly organised and detail-oriented

- Work well independently without constant supervision

- Enjoy taking responsibility and closing loops

- Communicate clearly and professionally

- Feel satisfaction when systems run smoothly

- Care about doing work properly, not just quickly



Experience with Canva, basic video editing, and social media workflows is important — but mindset and reliability matter more than perfection.



EXPERIENCE



- Experience with Canva, content scheduling, or social media support is required

- Experience with GHL is a bonus (training can be provided)

- You do not need formal marketing qualifications



REMUNERATION & GROWTH



Salary is AUD $800–$900 per month, depending on experience and demonstrated capability.



This role has the potential to grow over time as trust, skill, and responsibility grow. We value long-term working relationships and reward people who consistently deliver value.



HOW TO APPLY



Please
:



- Your most recent resume

- A short cover letter explaining:

- Why this role feels aligned for you

- Why you enjoy organising, finishing, and owning work



Important:

Please write “APPLICATION” in the subject line so your application is reviewed.



Shortlisted applicants will be invited to complete a short video application as the next step.



Thank you for your time and care in applying.

If this role feels like a natural fit, we look forward to meeting you.



Warmly,

Jillian

Founder — The Physio Doctor & Empowered Wellness Academy

title: Junior Graphic Artist

, Instagram, and TikTok

title: Outbound Growth Specialist (Cold Calling)
description:
About TruDOQ

TruDOQ is a simple, secure, and fast digital signing tool built for the modern era of business. We’ve solved the biggest flaw in digital agreements by attaching a photo to every signature, adding a vital layer of security and identity verification. We are a lean, results-driven startup looking for a professional who values honesty, independence, and the challenge of scaling a high-potential product.



The Role

We are looking for an Outbound Cold Calling Specialist who is a natural "hunter." You will be responsible for reaching out to business owners and decision-makers in the US to introduce them to the security and simplicity of TruDOQ. Your goal is to get them to see the value in photo-verified signatures and invite them to use the platform.



Key Responsibilities

- Outbound Prospecting: Conduct high-volume cold calls to US companies during their business hours.

- Effective Pitching: Communicate TruDOQ’s unique value—specifically how our photo-verification prevents fraud and adds trust to digital contracts.

- Lead Conversion: Drive sign-ups and schedule demos with interested prospects.

- Independent Management: We do not micromanage. You are expected to manage your time, hit your targets, and maintain a high level of activity autonomously.

- Reporting & Integrity: Provide honest, accurate daily reports on call volume and lead status.



Technical & Workspace Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

To ensure a professional experience for our US clients, you must meet the following:

- Hardware: A reliable PC/Laptop (Core i5 or higher preferred) with at least 8GB RAM.

- Audio: A dedicated Noise-Canceling Headset (e.g., Jabra, Plantronics, or similar).

- Internet: A stable, high-speed fiber connection (minimum 25 Mbps) with a backup power/internet solution.

- Environment: A dedicated, private home office space that is 100% free from background noise (no barking dogs, traffic, or crowing chickens).



What We’re Looking For

- Shift Availability: Strictly willing and able to work the Night Shift to align with US Business Hours (Eastern or Pacific Time).

- The Voice: Fluent English with a clear, neutral American accent. You must be comfortable engaging in high-level business conversations.

- Experience: Previous experience in outbound cold calling or B2B sales.

- Mindset: Entrepreneurial and self-starting. You don’t wait for instructions; you find ways to get the "Yes."

- Character: Uncompromising integrity. You do the work with 100% honesty and transparency.

- Equipment: Reliable computer, noise-canceling headset, and a stable, high-speed internet connection.



Why Join TruDOQ?

- Early Team Role: Help build and scale a startup from the ground up.

- Remote-First: Work from home with a focus on results, not hours logged.

- Straightforward Product: Pitch a tool that is easy to understand and solves a real security problem.

- Growth: Opportunity for bonuses based on performance and lead quality.



To Apply: 

Please send the following two items:

1. Resume or LinkedIn Profile

2. Equipment List: Briefly list your PC/Laptop specs (RAM/Processor), your headset model (must be noise-canceling), and your internet speed.

Review client credit reports from all three major bureaus (Equifax, Experian, TransUnion)

Identify inaccurate, outdated, incomplete, or unverifiable items

Prepare and submit dispute letters to credit bureaus and creditors

Track dispute timelines and follow up on responses

Maintain accurate records of disputes, outcomes, and client files

Communicate progress updates to clients clearly and professionally

Ensure compliance with FCRA, FDCPA, and other applicable credit laws

Assist with goodwill letters, validation requests, and escalations when needed

Protect client confidentiality and sensitive financial information

description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Finance Specialist to support our financial operations, reporting, and compliance processes. This role involves maintaining accurate financial records, assisting in financial reporting and analysis, supporting US tax compliance, and ensuring smooth accounts payable and receivable functions.



Key Responsibilities:

- Perform daily bookkeeping tasks, ensuring all transactions are properly recorded and classified.

- Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, including profit and loss statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.

- Generate various financial reports to support decision-making and provide insights into financial performance.

- Assist with budgeting and forecasting processes.

- Support in Invoicing & Billing

- Maintain accurate client & vendor records.

- Assist with the preparation and filing of various US tax forms (e.g., sales tax, 1099s).

- Support the compilation of necessary documentation for income tax preparation.

- Ensure compliance with relevant US tax regulations.

- Assist with internal and external audits by providing necessary documentation and support.

- Ensure compliance with all accounting standards and company policies.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

- 1 year of experience in bookkeeping, accounting, or finance

- Proficiency in QuickBooks or similar accounting software

- Solid understanding of US taxation basics (e.g., 1099, sales tax)

- Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills

- Experience supporting audits and ensuring financial compliance

- High attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines

title: Outbound Sales Development Representative
description:
This role is strategically focused on generating new business opportunities through targeted outbound outreach. The Outbound SDR serves as the first point of contact for potential clients, identifying prospects, initiating conversations, and driving them into the sales pipeline. You will manage outbound campaigns, conduct personalized outreach, and build strong engagement with high-value leads. This position requires strong persistence, excellent communication skills, and the ability to build effective processes for high-touch outbound engagement.

- Lead Qualification: Evaluate outbound prospects to ensure alignment with service offerings and pass qualified opportunities to the sales team.

- Collaboration With Sales & Marketing: Work closely with sales to refine ideal client profiles and with marketing to improve outbound messaging and campaign performance.

- Process Building & Optimization: Develop, refine, and scale processes for efficient and high-touch outbound engagement.



Qualifications:

- Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail.

- Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding outreach and pipeline targets.

- Advanced knowledge of HubSpot preferred; experience with other CRM tools is a plus.

- Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

- Motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive tasks forward.

- Comfortable with leadership, taking initiative, and improving workflows.

title: Content Creator (TikTok, Instagram) with sense of humor and interest in Personal Development
description:
Honestly, all these other job postings here sound reallyy dry and boring :D 



Let me try differently.



I don't care about hard skills. I just need someone outgoing and ON FIRE about personal development, who would like to use my App for his/her day-to-day personal development and share the journey online, through all ups and downs :)



That's it.



Your win: Well, the salary, of course.

Your other win: You'll improve in the areas you would like to improve in, personally - 100% guaranteed.

Your other win: You'll learn how to build a personal, authentic brand online. That you may later use for your own business? I'm very happy to help with any experiment of your own.

My win: You become an authentic face of the brand :) Super valuable for growing a community.



THE APP (iPhone only)

I realized that almost everyone would like to grow as a person, but no one REALLY knows how and where to start.

Having lots of experience in this area, I've built the first proper SYSTEM for personal development - so that literally anyone can start easily and doesn't need to buy an expensive Coach.

-> "Identity - Your Growth System" in the App Store, just check it out, it's free. Early user feedback (250 users) has been insane! 



The App structures this whole journey, gives lots of guidance and makes tracking super intuitive.



YOUR CONCRETE DELIVERABLES

1 Reel per Day. 

We iterate between low-effort reels, medium-effort, and high-effort.

Low-Effort: Static shot, with single-statement on the screen

Medium-Effort: Talking to the camera, sharing some learning/insight/struggle/tips

High-Effort: "Day in the Life" type Reel

-> I built a content engine that spits out a lot of ideas/messages, for the days where you don't have something natural to share



WAYS OF WORKING

No micro-managing at all. We discuss the goals I have for the channel, and you have full creative freedom. I'm always available to assist with sparring ideas or removing blockers. We do a (paid) weekly feedback call, to discuss what is going good and what can be improved from both sides.



WHAT I'M HOPING FOR

The only thing important for me is that you are an outgoing personality, and that you are really passionate about personal growth. Not necessarily that you're already an expert, but that you would LOVE to become one.

Some examples:

- reaching fitness goals (gym, calisthenics, pilates, yoga, core workouts, running, ..)

- happiness and mindfulness (meditation, breathing, journaling, reducing doomscrolling, ..)

- getting a better rhythm (sleeping times, waking times, evening routine, morning routine, ..)

- better social life (meeting friends for coffee, organizing a dinner, calling friends/family, ..)

- learning/curiosity (reading, podcasts, ..)

- creativity (writing, painting, making music, ..)

- purpose (side hustle, volunteering, ..)



IF YOU HAVE READ UNTIL HERE

You're most likely a good candidate, otherwise you wouldn't have remained interested ;)

Begin your application with "LETS HAVE SOME FUN", then a small text (2-5 sentences) explaining why you would love to get this job, and what makes you a good fit. End with "I have an iPhone" (you must be an iPhone user, because the App is iPhone-only).

Feel free to attach any supporting material if you want.



KICKOFF

Two paid trial weeks, for both of us to see whether it's a good fit :)

title: CRM & Systems Automation Specialist (GoHighLevel)
description:

Proactive • Adaptive • Genuine • Dedicated • Organised



Culture matters here. Skill gets you in the door. Standards keep you here.



The Role



We are looking for a high-level problem solver who thrives on building complex automation systems and wants to challenge themselves.



This is NOT a repetitive admin role.

We build advanced automations and expect precision.



You must:



Solve complex problems independently



Build clean, scalable systems



Triple-check everything before going live



Think long-term, not quick fixes

Create and optimise workflows, triggers, pipelines, automations

Build advanced Zapier integrations (multi-step, paths, filters, webhooks, API connections)

Troubleshoot complex automation failures

QA and stress-test workflows before launch

Collaborate closely with marketing and client success teams



Required Experience:



Strong GoHighLevel experience (workflows, pipelines, triggers, forms, calendars, webhooks)

Strong Zapier experience

Strong logical problem-solving skills

Clear communication

Ownership mindset



Bonus Experience (Highly Valued)

Meta Ads

Google Ads

SEO

UTM & tracking knowledge

API / webhook experience





Who This Role Is For

We only want applicants who genuinely want this job.

This role is for someone who:



Wants long-term employment



Wants to grow inside one company



Wants to challenge themselves technically



Wants to build real systems, not just complete tasks



We are looking for someone long-term.

If you perform well, we will help you grow professionally and financially.



Hiring Process



Screening Call



Culture Interview



Technical Interview



Only serious applicants will move forward.



How To Apply (MANDATORY)

Generic videos will not be considered.



In your video, you must include:

Your age



Your hobbies

Your Values



Why you want to work specifically with Tradie Pulse (not a generic answer)



Your GHL experience



A complex problem you solved (and how you solved it)



Why you believe you fit our culture (Proactive, Adaptive, Genuine, Dedicated, Organised)



Why you are looking for long-term employment



What your long-term career goals are



We want a custom video specifically made for Tradie Pulse.

Your expected monthly salary (AUD)



Applications without a Loom video will be ignored.

description:
Title: Immediate Bookkeeping Needed – Personal & Business Accounts

title: Webflow Developer (Remote – EST Hours)
description:
Role Overview



We are looking for a Webflow Specialist who lives and breathes the platform. You’ll be responsible for taking high-fidelity designs (Figma/Adobe XD) and turning them into pixel-perfect, responsive, and high-performing websites. The ideal candidate understands that Webflow is more than just "drag-and-drop"—it’s a visual interface for writing clean HTML, CSS, and JS.



Key Responsibilities:

-Development: Build, launch, and maintain complex websites using Webflow.

-Design-to-Code: Translate Figma designs into responsive layouts with meticulous attention to detail (padding, typography, and grid structures).

-CMS Architecture: Structure scalable Collections and CMS databases to empower content editors.

-Interactions & Animations: Create engaging "wow-factor" experiences using Webflow Interactions and GSAP/Lottie where necessary.

-Optimization: Ensure lightning-fast load speeds, clean class naming conventions (e.g., Client-First or Finsweet logic), and SEO best practices.

-Integrations: Connect Webflow with third-party tools like Zapier, Make, Memberstack, or Airtable to extend functionality.



Required Technical Skills:



-Advanced Webflow: Deep knowledge of the Designer, Editor, and CMS.

-Front-End Fundamentals: Strong understanding of HTML5, CSS3 (Flexbox, Grid), and basic JavaScript.

-Responsive Design: Expertise in building for all breakpoints (Mobile, Tablet, Desktop, Ultra-wide).

-SEO & Performance: Knowledge of schema markup, alt tags, asset minification, and Google PageSpeed Insights.

-Frameworks: Familiarity with modern Webflow frameworks like Finsweet Client-First or Relume.



Soft Skills:



Problem Solver: You don't just see a bug; you enjoy finding the "why" behind it.

Communicator: Ability to explain technical constraints to non-technical designers or clients.

Detail-Oriented: You notice if a margin is 16px instead of 20px.

title: Senior Lending Intelligence Specialist (Former Underwriter / Processor Required) — Remote
description:
Read Carefully Before Applying



This role is reserved for professionals with real, hands-on experience inside lending decision environments. We are not hiring general virtual assistants. We are seeking someone who has personally worked with loan files, underwriting decisions, lender portals, or submission systems and understands approval behavior from direct exposure.



If you have not worked inside lending operations, underwriting, processing, or broker submissions, this position is not for you.



?



Location Requirement: Philippines Only

Position Type: Remote Contract

Compensation: Base Pay + Approval Commissions + Performance Bonuses



High performers in this role earn significantly more over time due to performance-based incentives tied to successful client funding outcomes. Tea
mbers who contribute valuable lender intelligence and help clients secure large approvals receive additional bonuses.



We are looking for someone who wants long-term stability, growth, and a place to build their career. The right candidate will be supported, respected, rewarded, and treated as a core tea
mber.



?



Mission of This Role

Your objective is to document real lender approval behavior and build structured intelligence showing:

 • which lenders approve which borrower profiles

 • what thresholds typically pass or fail

 • which institutions are strict vs flexible

 • where the highest approvals occur



This is strategic work that directly impacts funding outcomes.



?



Responsibilities

 • Record real-world approval patterns based on prior experience

 • Identify profile ranges lenders tend to approve:

 • credit score bands

 • income ranges

 • DTI tolerance patterns

 • business revenue ranges

 • time-in-business tendencies

 • Document lender behavior patterns:

 • stipulation tendencies

 • approval speed

 • risk tolerance

 • documentation strictness

 • Organize findings into structured spreadsheets/databases

 • Assist in building lender ranking models



?



Required Experience (At Least One)

 • Loan Underwriter

 • Loan Processor

 • Lending Operations Specialist

 • Funding Submission Specialist

 • Credit Analyst

 • Broker Submission Manager



Applications without verifiable lending experience will be declined.



?



Strong Advantages

Candidates with any of the following receive priority consideration:

 • Prior relationships with lender representatives or bank contacts

 • Previous access to underwriting or approval data

 • Experience submitting to multiple lenders

 • Ability to recall real approval thresholds fro
mory



?



Qualification Verification Section (Required)

Answer all questions. Incomplete answers indicate lack of real experience.

 1. Describe one borrower profile you personally saw approved that surprised you. Include score, income/revenue, and why it was unusual.

 2. Name one lender that consistently approved lower-tier applicants and explain what made them more flexible.

 3. List the three most common decline reasons you observed across applications.

 4. What factors mattered more than credit score in approvals?

 5. Describe the difference between a file that gets instant approval vs manual review.



?



Success Benchmark (First 30 Days)

You will deliver a structured intelligence report outlining:

 • lender approval tiers

 • borrower ranges by lender type

 • observed approval probability patterns

 • institutions most likely to approve borderline files



?



How to Apply

Submit:

 • Resume

 • Answers to verification questions

 • WhatsApp number

 •
 address



Applications missing any of the above will not be reviewed.



?



Final Note

This opportunity is designed for experienced lending professionals seeking a serious long-term role where their knowledge directly impacts real approvals. If you have genuine industry experience, your expertise will be valued and rewarded here.

title: Seeking Personal Assistant to CEO ( Degree Holders Only)
description:
15 APPLY POINTS REQUIRED FOR JOB - If you apply for this role with below 15 points your messages are automatically deleted

====================================================================================================

Personal Assistant to CEO



Full-Time | Long-Term Contract | Immediate Start

Accounting & Financial Services Firm



?



About Our Firm



We are an established accounting and financial services firm providing structured financial management, accounts oversight, cash flow monitoring, invoice recovery coordination, and operational reporting for growing businesses. Our firm operates with corporate-level standards, strict confidentiality protocols, and performance-driven systems. We support company directors and finance teams by implementing disciplined financial processes, improving reporting accuracy, and ensuring professional client communication at all times. Precision, accountability, and discretion are central to how we operate.



?



Position Overview



We are hiring 1 Personal Assistant to directly support the CEO.



This is a high-responsibility role requiring maturity, strong communication skills, and proven executive-level support experience.



This is not an entry-level position.



?



Compensation

Month 1 (Probation): $4 per hour

After successful probation: Increase to $5–$8 per hour based on performance



?



Working Hours



Monday to Friday

9:00am – 5:00pm

Full-Time

Professional home office required



Must be able to start immediately or within 7 days.



?



Mandatory Experience Requirements



You must have:



• 3+ consecutive years (2023, 2024, 2025, 2026) in a similar Personal Assistant / Executive Assistant role

• Experience working for a verified company

• A company we can call for reference verification

• A direct manager who can confirm your employment





If you claim NDA and cannot discuss your previous employer or responsibilities, do not apply.

We verify experience.



?



Education Requirement



• Bachelor’s Degree required

(Degree holders only)



?



Core Responsibilities



• Managing and protecting CEO calendar and schedule

• Handling executive-level
 communication

• Coordinating meetings and follow-ups

• Tracking KPIs and preparing structured reports

• Managing staff rotas and accountability

• Assisting with recruitment coordination

• Supporting financial tracking and invoice follow-ups

• Maintaining organised documentation and dashboards

• Acting as operational support and gatekeeper for CEO



?



Required Skills



• Fluent, professional spoken and written English

• Strong Excel / Google Sheets capability

• Experience handling confidential financial data

• Strong organisational and decision-making skills

• Calm under pressure

• Process-driven mindset



?



Compliance & Background Checks



Background verification checks will be conducted before final appointment.



Strict confidentiality is required. NDA will be signed.



?



Application Instructions



To be considered, include: IN THE FOLLOWING ORDER NUMBER YOUR RESPONSES 

TIME WASTERS WILL GETTHERE ACCOUNTS REPORTED

 1. Company name worked for in 2023, 2024, 2025, 2026

 2. Industry you worked in 

 3. Detailed daily responsibilities

 4. Degree details (institution + year completed)

 5. Confirmation you can start within 7 days

6. Your whats app contact details and
 address



Start your application with: CEO/PA26
salary: $4 p/h starting After Inc $5–$8 per hour

title: 3D Designer
description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and fast-working 3D Designer for an urgent event project. The ideal candidate must be professional, detail-oriented, and able to work under tight deadlines.

Work from the provided IMAX file.



Relocate and adjust the existing designed elements from the IMAX file.

A moon structure (7m x 7m).

title: Security Solutions Pre-Sales Engineer - WFH
description:
We are looking for a Technical Strategist to support our regional growth by developing advanced security solutions. In this role, you will design enterprise-level systems and use AI-driven tools alongside global best practices to deliver high-quality project proposals.



Key Responsibilities



-Lead the development of system architectures, diagrams, bills of quantities (BOQs), and compliance documentation for large-scale enterprise projects.

-Create solutions that integrate Access Control and CCTV systems with APIs and automated workflows.

-Handle customer inquiries and provide pre-sales technical support through a work-from-home setup.

-Partner with internal technical teams to strengthen product expertise and maximize the use of AI-enabled support tools.



Requirements



-Proven background in Enterprise Security Systems (Access Control and/or CCTV). Experience with major international platforms such as Genetec, Milestone, or HID is an advantage.

-Engineering degree from a recognized institution with a minimum of 2 years of relevant professional experience.

-Candidates with Philippine market experience or returning OFWs from the Middle East are encouraged to apply.

-Strong neutral English communication skills for regional client interaction and demonstrated ability to work independently in a remote environment.

title: Account Manager (Creative Agency) - WFH
description:
Important note: We are looking for applicants who CAN START IMMEDIATELY, WITHOUT A NOTICE PERIOD.



We are a creative agency specializing in retail and travel retail design, and we are looking for a proactive and approachable team player to join our creative team. The successful candidate will work closely with brands and retailers to deliver innovative and impactful solutions. This role requires a balance of client management, creative insight, and operational excellence to support ambitious growth goals.



Key Responsibilities:

-Manage and deliver day-to-day operational requirements for clients across all projects.

-Own the briefing process and coordinate creative proposals, including development, negotiation, evaluation, and recommendations.

-Assist the creative team by consolidating insights from multiple sources into clear, actionable presentations.

-Conduct market research, analyze trends, and benchmark against competitors.

-Contribute to the design thinking process and help create inspirational design presentations.

-Create and maintain project schedules, proactively identifying risks and tracking milestones.

-Ensure agreements are maintained, and all project documentation is organized.

-Perform regular competitive evaluations to inform strategy and creative direction.

-Foster strong working relationships internally and externally.



Qualifications & Skills:

-Open-minded, curious, and genuinely interested in the design world.

-Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with clients and teams.

-Highly organized and detail-oriented, with excellent project management skills.

-Creative thinker with the ability to generate insightful ideas and support innovative solutions.

title: Executive Assistant (Construction & Operations Support)
description:
Company Overview

A fast-growing construction and real estate development company based in Austin. The founder is highly active in the field, managing site crews, vendors, material orders, and development projects while also maintaining client and supplier relationships. The business is expanding, and leadership needs stronger operational support to streamline communication, coordination, and time management.



Role: Executive Assistant (Construction & Operations Support)

This is a full-time, high-trust gatekeeper role supporting the founder directly.

The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, confident on the phone, and comfortable coordinating vendors and construction teams. This person will act as a true extension of the founder, filtering communication, organizing priorities, and ensuring nothing falls through the cracks.





Core Responsibilities

1. Inbox & Communication Gatekeeping

Monitor and manage high-volume inbox (2,000+
s)

Filter: must-see vs reply vs archive

Draft and send replies on behalf of the founder

Flag urgent items

Maintain inbox organization and tagging

Act as internal communication buffer for team

Route internal team requests properly before they reach founder

This person is the primary filter and communication gatekeeper.



2. Daily Priority Management

Create structured daily briefings:

Must-do items

Important but not urgent

On radar

Send morning priority summary

Follow up on deadlines

Track outstanding tasks

Organize calendar blocks

Ensure time is allocated appropriately for site vs admin vs vendor calls

This role keeps the founder focused on high-value execution.



3. Construction Project Coordination Support

Work inside Buildertrend (construction PM tool)

Coordinate material orders

Track vendor communication

Build supply lists for upcoming projects

Draft and submit supplier
s

Ensure orders are placed on time

Track turnaround timelines

Follow up with vendors when needed

Maintain Airtable and Google Workspace systems

Not heavy accounting, but operational tracking and supply coordination.



4. Internal Team Coordination

Act as point of contact between site team and founder

Collect requests from field crew

Clarify information before escalating

Reduce repetitive interruptions

Document and relay decisions clearly

Must be confident speaking with construction crews and suppliers.



5. Administrative Support

Calendar management

Scheduling calls

Blocking time

Organizing Google Drive files

Light data entry

Updating project records



6. Light Marketing & Content Support (5–10%)

Organize media clips from shared folders

Draft preliminary
s

Coordinate content handoff to marketing team

Assist with simple social media posting

Organize construction site photos/videos



Required Skills

Excellent spoken and written English

Comfortable making phone calls on behalf of founder

Confident communicating with vendors and suppliers

Strong organizational skills

Independent thinker

Ability to say “I don’t understand” when needed

Proactive follow-up

High accountability

Comfortable working with construction terminology



Tools:

Google Workspace

Airtable

Buildertrend (or willing to learn quickly)

 management systems



Strongly Preferred

Construction industry experience

Real estate development experience

Experience coordinating vendors or supply chains

Experience supporting a founder or executive

US business hours availability



Personality Fit

Assertive but professional

Clear communicator

Calm under pressure

Detail-oriented

Comfortable being a gatekeeper

High ownership mentality

Not passive

This person will be a visible extension of leadership.

title: Personal Assistant & Data Manager
description:
Personal Assistant & Data Manager 

Remote | Full-Time | 9AM–6PM CST (1-hour break)



About the Role



We are hiring a Growth & Operations Assistant to serve as the internal control tower of our company.



Company Structure



Founder

V

Growth & Operations Assistant (You)

V

Sales Team + Dispatch Team





Tech Stack (Required Experience)



You will work daily inside:

• Gmail

• Google Sheets

• ClickUp

• Slack

• Text Messaging (SMS platforms)

• Phone Calls (professional communication required)

• 
 CRM (Preferred)



You must be comfortable managing multiple systems at once.

Primary Responsibilities

1. Sales Support & Growth Control



• Monitor inbound leads

• Track sales pipeline

• Identify follow-up gaps

• Confirm contracts are signed

• Confirm payment is collected

• Log client data into CRM

• Track sales productivity (calls, closes, follow-ups)

• Manage referral and affiliate tracking

Outcome: No lost leads. No incomplete onboarding. No ghost accounts.



2. Client Onboarding & Transition

• Verify documentation

• Confirm setup requirements

• log onboarding checklist in ClickUp

• Notify Dispatch when the client is ready

• Ensure smooth hand-off from Sales to Dispatch

Outcome: Dispatch only receives fully prepared clients.



3. Dispatch Insight 

• Track weekly load counts

• Track revenue per client

• Identify churn risks early

• Mark and resolve client issues 

Outcome: Full revenue visibility at all times.



4. KPI Reporting & Data Management

• Track team performance metrics

• Organize operational data

• Send structured daily reports to the Founder

• Highlight risks before they become losses

Outcome: Leadership sees numbers clearly and acts quickly.



Daily Workflow

Morning (Start of Shift)



Send a structured “Good Morning” report including:

Previous Day Data

• Sales performance numbers, & Important sales messages

• Call volume (with timestamps)

• Dispatch performance + yesterday hours

• if any Client updates



Today’s Calendar (Step-by-Step with Times & Locations)

Example:

• 1:00 PM CST – Ian Call (Cell)

• 2:30 PM – Roman Callback (Cell)

• 3:00 PM CST – Allan (Google Meeting)

• 4:00 PM – Haircut (Smitty’s)

• 6:00 PM – Dinner with Riley (Mother’s Tavern)



Post the previous-day numbers in Slack to the Sales Team.



Midday



• Monitor sales volume and send encouragement in Slack

• Send 50 SMS and 50
s to leads

• Respond to incoming messages

• Monitor onboarding progress

• Follow up on open tasks



End of Day



• 3:30 PM CST / 4:30 PM EST – Post daily sales stats in Slack

• Update ClickUp / Google Sheets (Clients, Sales, Dispatch)

• Send KPI, volume, and hour report to Founder

• Flag risks, bottlenecks, alerts

• Confirm next-day priorities



Success Metrics



• Zero unlogged clients

• Zero missed follow-ups

• Accurate revenue tracking

• Reduced churn

• Faster onboarding time

• Clean, consistent daily reporting



Ideal Candidate



• Extremely organized

• Detail-oriented

• Process-driven

• Comfortable managing multiple tools

• Strong written and verbal communication

• Professional on phone and text

• Proactive and consistent





To apply, include:



• Resume

- an introduction video of you 

• Tools you have used before

• Confirmation you can work 9AM–6PM CST

• Example of a daily operations report you’ve created

title: Executive Relationship Manager
description:
Company Overview

We support a high-end consulting and advisory firm that works directly with founders and executive teams at large, complex organizations. The business delivers strategic engagements around operations, culture, and leadership, typically serving companies in the hundreds of millions in revenue.

The firm is founder-led, relationship-driven, and known for deep, trusted advisory work rather than transactional consulting. The next phase of growth requires building a more repeatable, thoughtful sales motion without losing the personal, high-touch approach that defines the brand.



Role Overview

This is not a traditional sales or SDR role.

The Executive Relationship Manager works directly under Scott to support a small number of high-value client relationships and opportunities. The role exists to extend founder-led sales efforts, ensure warm opportunities are nurtured properly, and create continuity between marketing interest and executive-level sales conversations.

Success in this role comes from precision, discretion, and follow-through, not volume.

You will manage a limited number of carefully selected accounts, pay close attention to context and timing, and help move conversations forward in a way that feels personal, thoughtful, and aligned with senior executive expectations.

This role may support one primary client initially, with the opportunity to support a second similar client over time.



Core Responsibilities

Relationship Management & Follow-Up

Manage a small portfolio of high-priority target accounts

Maintain detailed context on relationships, prior conversations, and internal notes

Ensure warm opportunities never go cold due to lack of follow-up



Thoughtful Outreach & Communication

Draft and send highly personalized outreach
s or messages

Reference context, prior touchpoints, and known relationships

Communicate in a professional, discreet, executive-appropriate tone



Sales Support & Coordination

Prepare Scott with background and context before meetings

Handle post-meeting follow-up and next-step coordination

Keep 
ntum moving between conversations



Signal Tracking & Prioritization

Monitor warm signals such as website engagement, inbound interest, or referrals

Identify when outreach is timely and relevant

Surface priority opportunities to Scott with clear context



Systems & Organization

Keep CRM or tracking systems clean and accurate

Document relationship status and next actions clearly

Provide visibility into active conversations without unnecessary noise



Nice-to-Have / Expansion Responsibilities

These are not required on day one, but may become part of the role over time:

Provide feedback on messaging or conversion gaps based on conversations

Conduct light research on executives or target accounts

Support similar relationship-driven sales motions for an additional client

Participate in incentive or bounty structures tied to qualified meetings or closed deals



Ideal Candidate Profile

This role is a strong fit for someone who:

Has experience supporting senior leaders, executives, or high-touch clients

Comes from an executive assistant, consulting support, hospitality, PR, or client services background

Enjoys managing a small number of important relationships deeply

Is highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive

Communicates clearly and professionally in writing

Does not want a high-volume sales or cold outreach role

title: Short Term Rental Pricing Manager
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Short-Term Rental Pricing Manager to lead and execute dynamic pricing strategies across our portfolio of short-term rental properties. This role is responsible for optimising revenue performance across major OTA platforms including Airbnb, 
, and other online travel agencies (OTAs).



The ideal candidate is an expert in revenue management for short-term rentals, understands market demand dynamics, and is highly proficient in PMS and channel management systems. This person thrives on data, precision, and organization, and has a strong commercial mindset.



Key Responsibilities

- Pricing & Revenue Optimization

- Develop and implement dynamic pricing strategies to maximize occupancy, ADR, and RevPAR

- Continuously analyze market demand, seasonality, competitor pricing, local events, and booking trends

- Adjust daily pricing across all platforms based on performance data and market conditions

- Conduct weekly and monthly performance reviews and revenue forecasting

- Monitor and optimize minimum stay rules, gap nights, discounts, and promotional strategies

- OTA & Channel Management

- Manage and optimize listings across Airbnb, 
, and other OTAs

- Ensure rate parity and consistency across all channels

- Work within PMS and channel manager systems to push pricing updates accurately

- Troubleshoot rate discrepancies, sync errors, and distribution issues

- Coordinate with marketing and operations teams to align pricing with promotions and availability

- Systems & Reporting

- Utilize Property Management Systems (PMS) and Channel Managers efficiently

- Build and maintain pricing dashboards and reports

- Track KPIs such as ADR, occupancy rate, booking pace, and revenue growth

- Use data-driven insights to guide pricing decisions

- Required Skills & Qualifications

- Proven experience in short-term rental revenue management

- Strong expertise in dynamic pricing strategies

- Advanced understanding of OTA algorithms and ranking factors

- Deep familiarity with PMS and channel manager systems

- Exceptional attention to detail

- Highly organized with strong process discipline

- Strong analytical and data interpretation skills

- in Excel/Google Sheets (advanced formulas, forecasting models)

- Ability to make fast, confident decisions based on data

- problem-solving skills

- English written and verbal communication skills

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple properties simultaneously



Preferred Qualifications

- Experience managing large short-term rental portfolios

- Familiarity with revenue management software tools

- Experience in hospitality, real estate, or property management

- Knowledge of market analytics tools (AirDNA, PriceLabs, Beyond, etc.)

- Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality, Business, Finance, or related field



Ideal Candidate Profile



The ideal candidate is:

- Extremely detail-oriented and structured

- Data-driven and commercially minded

- Proactive and forward-thinking

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment

- Tech-savvy and systems-oriented

- Accountable and results-focused



What Success Looks Like



- Increased occupancy and revenue across the portfolio

- Accurate and consistent pricing across all channels

- Improved booking pace and market competitiveness

- Clear, actionable reporting and forecasting
