title: Sales Account Manager – B2B Sourcing & Account Growth
description:
The Company: Anything Supplies and SALS3

Anything Supplies is rapidly growing as "The Supply Giant Behind Your Business", a dynamic B2B wholesale and global sourcing platform. Having secured our lead pipeline, we are now seeking a proven closer and relationship builder to take ownership of high-value client accounts. We specialize in providing bulk supply solutions across an enormous range of categories, from building materials and industrial hardware to medical supplies and electronics.



Your Mission

You will be the primary revenue driver for Anything Supplies. Your role is twofold: Close the qualified leads generated by our Lead Gen team, and then Nurture and Expand those closed accounts to maximize repeat bulk orders. You will manage the entire post-qualification sales cycle, from negotiation to closing and account retention.



Key Responsibilities

1. Sales Closing & Negotiation (The Closer):

Take ownership of high-quality Quote Requests (SQLs) generated by the SDR team.

Conduct deep-dive discovery and final sales calls with procurement managers, business owners, and C-level executives.

Manage the entire pricing negotiation process, ensuring deals are structured for mutual profitability and long-term partnership.

Consistently meet and exceed monthly and quarterly revenue targets based on bulk order closures.



2. Strategic Account Management (The Relationship Builder):

Develop and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key client accounts, becoming their trusted sourcing advisor.

Identify opportunities for account expansion, including upselling higher-margin products and cross-selling across our diverse catalog.

Manage the post-sale relationship, ensuring client satisfaction and securing consistent, predictable repeat business.

Develop strategic account plans to grow the yearly volume and value of your assigned client portfolio.



3. Pipeline and Operations:

Accurately forecast monthly sales, pipeline health, and revenue using our CRM (Go High Level and other platforms).

Collaborate closely with the Lead Generation and SDR teams to optimize the quality of incoming leads and streamline the quote-to-cash process.



Required Qualifications

Experience: 3+ years of proven, full-cycle B2B sales experience (Account Executive, Account Manager, or similar closer role). Experience in wholesale, sourcing, supply chain, or industrial sales is a significant advantage.



Closing Record: Demonstrable track record of meeting and exceeding high sales quotas.



Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills, with the gravitas required to negotiate complex deals with high-level B2B decision-makers.



B2B Acumen: Deep understanding of procurement cycles, bulk ordering logistics, and managing long-term business relationships.



Tools: Highly proficient with CRM software (Go High Level/HubSpot/Salesforce) and Microsoft Excel for tracking and deal analysis.



Compensation and Rewards

Competitive Base Salary: We offer a base salary of 35,000 PHP per month.

Commission: Significant variable commission tied directly to Closed Revenue and a lucrative accelerator structure rewarding Account Growth and Repeat Business.



If you are a driven sales professional ready to take ownership of key accounts and directly influence the growth of a dynamic B2B sourcing platform, we want to hear from you.

Please send your resume to 
 with your name and the position you are applying for as the subject line

title: Senior Backend PHP Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a Senior Backend PHP Engineer to help design and build the scalable backbone of HelloPrint’s ecommerce platforms. You’ll work on microservices, APIs, and integrations, while mentoring others and driving technical excellence.



You’ll take a leading role in shaping the architecture of our ecommerce infrastructure. You’ll build reliable APIs, optimize performance, and ensure our systems scale as we expand globally. Beyond coding, you’ll mentor teammates, influence technical direction, and contribute to a high-performance engineering culture.



What You’ll Do:



- Architect Our API-First Future: Design, develop, and maintain a robust and high-performance API layer that will serve as the core of our headless platform.



- Own the Backend: Take full ownership of key backend services, from design to deployment, ensuring they align with our API-first strategy.



- Drive Modernization: Lead the modernization of our existing system, with a clear focus on decoupling the frontend from the backend and creating a clean, API-first architecture. We prefer a pragmatic approach over the complexity and overhead of microservices.



- Mentor and Lead: Guide and mentor other backend developers, sharing your expertise in API design, performance, and best practices.



- Collaborate and Innovate: Work closely with frontend engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to translate ambitious goals into practical, well-engineered API specifications and solutions.



- Champion Best Practices: Introduce and advocate for modern API development tools, standards, and methodologies (e.g., OpenAPI, CI/CD, comprehensive testing).



Requirements

What We’re Looking For:



- Proven Seniority: At least 5+ years of professional experience in backend development, with a strong focus on PHP.



- API-First Mindset: Demonstrated experience designing and building scalable, RESTful or GraphQL APIs. You have a deep understanding of what it means to build a headless system.



- PHP8 Expertise: Deep, hands-on experience with modern PHP, including PHP8 and modern design patterns like TDD. You are comfortable with frameworks like Symfony and understand the nuances of the PHP ecosystem.



- Strategic & Pragmatic: You are a problem-solver who prioritizes impact and understands the challenges of a large-scale modernization project. You know when to refactor and when to build new, all while avoiding unnecessary complexity.



- Ownership Mentality: You are proactive about identifying and fixing issues and feel a strong sense of responsibility for the performance and health of the codebase.



- Data Savvy: Strong experience with relational databases (MySQL/MariaDB) and a solid understanding of database design, optimization, and query performance in an API context.



- Experience with Git and agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).



- AI-Accelerated Development: You are knowledgeable about and in favor of using AI to accelerate the software development lifecycle. You're keen on exploring how AI can be leveraged to generate code, improve quality, and maximize output.





Nice to Have:



- Experience with e-commerce or high-traffic consumer environments.

- Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).

- Experience with message queues (e.g., GCP PubSub) or other asynchronous processing technologies.



What We Offer:

- Growth & Ownership: A performance culture where you grow fast, take ownership early, and design your own path: with access to AI learning and real responsibility.

- International Experience: Join a diverse team of 150+ HelloPrinters from 34+ nationalities, collaborating across countries, cultures, and functions.

- Impact & Innovation: Work in a fast-paced, tech-driven scale-up where your ideas shape the future of customised products.

- Collaboration: Learn from experienced leaders, contribute to meaningful projects, and thrive in a team that’s serious about performance and people.

- Celebrations & Culture: From work anniversaries and team events to monthly Keynotes and seasonal awards, we make time to celebrate wins and give back through volunteering.



Ready to Build the Future?

We are looking for bold thinkers, decisive executors, and engineers who embrace AI-first development.



If you're interested, apply here:

title: OPERATIONS LEAD AND CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE COORDINATOR (Attio experience preferred | Remote)
description:
ABOUT RELATIONAL MINDS



Relational Minds is an Australian child and family mental health organisation. We deliver relationship-focused, evidence-informed programs to parents, children, educators, and leaders. Our philosophy is grounded in relationship-first approaches, compassionate and respectful communication, and trauma-informed, evidence-based practice. Our clinical approach is grounded in Dyadic Developmental Psychotherapy (DDP) principles, with a strong emphasis on Playfulness, Acceptance, Curiosity, and Empathy (PACE). We support people to understand themselves and others more deeply.



We manage complex assessment and treatment pathways involving multiple clinicians and strict timelines. Our Family Experience Team ensures that every family journey is coordinated, tracked, and completed using a centralised Microsoft 365 architecture.



We value kindness, clarity, and reliable teamwork. We provide a supportive Australian leadership team that appreciates initiative and offers a calm, respectful, emotionally intelligent work environment. This is a meaningful, mission-driven role with opportunities for professional growth.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

	•	Advanced Excel skills are essential

	•	Strong use of formulas, filters, conditional formatting, and multi-sheet trackers

	•	High-level database and data-management experience

	•	Experience coordinating workflows across multiple stakeholders

	•	Experience working with Australian companies is essential

	•	Excellent written English and professional communication skills

	•	Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple cases



PREFERRED (STRONGLY REGARDED)

	•	Experience working with CRM systems to manage customer or client journeys

	•	Direct experience using Attio CRM, including:

	•	Managing pipelines and lifecycle stages

	•	Creating custom fields and views

	•	Using filters to surface priority clients

	•	Ability to translate Excel-based workflows into Attio pipelines and logic

	•	Experience supporting or participating in a transition from spreadsheets to a CRM system

	•	Comfort working with evolving systems as the organisation scales



WORK DETAILS

 * Remote position

 * Full-time, long-term role

 * Work aligned with Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST) business hours

 

HOW TO APPLY



Please include the following in your application:

 * One specific example of how you used Microsoft Copilot or AI to automate a business process

 * A summary of your experience building and managing complex trackers in Excel Online

 * A description of your work history with Australian companies

 * One example of when you assertively followed up with a professional to meet a deadline



Shortlisted candidates will complete a practical technical assessment involving Excel Online and AI-driven data cleaning.

title: Plumbing Estimator / Takeoff Specialist
description:
Job Overview



We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Plumbing Estimator / Takeoff Specialist to join our team full-time. This role is responsible for performing accurate plumbing takeoffs from hydraulic and ground plan drawings to support project estimating and tender submissions.



This is a long-term remote position with consistent work, ideal for candidates with experience in plumbing, construction estimating, or quantity takeoffs.



Key Responsibilities



• Review architectural, hydraulic, and plumbing drawings

• Perform accurate plumbing quantity takeoffs

• Measure pipe runs, fittings, fixtures, and related components

• Prepare takeoff summaries and reports in Excel

• Mark up drawings using Bluebeam Revu and/or Groundplan

• Assist with estimate preparation when required

• Identify missing or unclear information in drawings

• Maintain organized takeoff and estimate records

• Communicate clearly with the estimating team



Required Skills and Experience



• Proven experience with plumbing takeoffs or construction estimating

• Ability to read and interpret hydraulic and ground plan drawings

• Experience using Bluebeam Revu and/or Groundplan

• Strong attention to detail and accuracy

• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

• Good written and verbal English communication skills

• Reliable internet connection and stable work environment



Preferred Qualifications (Advantageous but Not Required)



• Experience with SimPRO or similar estimating software

• Experience with Australian, US, or international construction projects

• Background in plumbing, construction, or engineering

• Experience working remotely with international teams



Why Join Us



• Long-term full-time role with consistent workload

• Work remotely from home

• Supportive and professional team environment

• Opportunity for growth into senior estimating roles



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:

Updated resume

Description of your plumbing takeoff experience

List of software you have used (Bluebeam, Groundplan, PlanSwift, etc.)

Sample takeoff work (if available)

Your availability and internet speed

Shortlisted candidates may be required to complete a short takeoff test.



IMPORTANT: Include the word BLUEBEAM in your application subject line to confirm you have read the job description.
